attributes.action: Would like Gordon Brown to intervene in the case of Akmal Shaikh, a mentally ill Briton facing the death sentence in China
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Would like Gordon Brown to intervene in the case of Akmal Shaikh, a mentally ill Briton facing the death sentence in China.  Clive Stafford Smith, from campaign group Reprieve, which is representing Mr Shaikh, called for "urgent and immediate" action from the Government.
He said: "Akmal Shaikh faces the possibility of a hollow-point bullet to the back of the head sometime very soon, unless Gordon Brown makes strong representations to President Hu."
"And at a bare minimum, the Prime Minister can surely ensure that we get a mental health expert in to see Mr Shaikh, so we can prove the seriousness of Mr Shaikh's illness to the Chinese courts."
